TITLE: Many younger baby boomers may outlive their 401(k) savings, new research finds. Here's why
SUMMARY: New research paints worrisome picture for how long 401(k) savings last retirees.

TITLE: Pandemic-era checks rewired how these Americans see money: 'Stimulus changed how I think about what's possible'
SUMMARY: Recipients of pandemic stimulus checks used funds to reduce debt, pay bills and build savings. For some, the money altered their financial psychology.

TITLE: As SEC charges first brokerage to run afoul of new investor protection rule, here's how to find a good financial advisor
SUMMARY: It may seem challenging to find a broker, financial advisor or financial planner you can trust. Here are some steps consumers can take to protect themselves.

TITLE: 80% of socially responsible ESG investors also own cryptocurrency: Here’s how they reconcile conflicting values
SUMMARY: Environmental, social and corporate governance investments attracted record new assets in 2021. A new survey takes a look at who is investing in this area.

TITLE: One key problem has 1 in 4 expats ‘seriously considering’ or ‘planning’ to renounce U.S. citizenship
SUMMARY: Roughly 1 in 4 American expats is “seriously considering” or “planning” to renounce their U.S. citizenship, according to a survey. Here’s the top reason why.

TITLE: 43% of homeowners have delayed home improvements and maintenance due to inflation. Here's why that's risky
SUMMARY: If inflation is squeezing your budget, there are steps you can take as a homeowner to help avoid costly fixes.

TITLE: Student loan forgiveness could help narrow the racial wealth gap, say advocates. Here's how
SUMMARY: Rather than narrowing the racial wealth gap between Black and white Americans, student loan debt is making things worse. Loan forgiveness could help, some say.

TITLE: College tuition bills are coming. Here are 3 ways to navigate them and give your 529 balance time to recover
SUMMARY: If you’re worried about a smaller 529 college savings plan balance, it may make sense to try and claim other credits while waiting for the account to recover.

TITLE: Amid high inflation, 36% of employees earning $100,000 or more say they are living paycheck to paycheck
SUMMARY: The share of workers earning at least $100,000 a year who report being cash-strapped is double what it was three years ago.

TITLE: Michigan officially becomes 14th state to mandate personal finance education before high school graduation
SUMMARY: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer on Thursday signed into law a bill guaranteeing access to personal finance education before high school graduation.

TITLE: Cost to finance a new car hits a record $656 per month — and auto shoppers could pay even more with latest Fed rate hike
SUMMARY: As interest rates head higher and auto prices remain elevated, monthly payments are expected to continue squeezing consumers' budgets.

TITLE: Food stamps, credit card debt: Record high inflation forces some older Americans to make tough financial choices
SUMMARY: Older Americans who rely on Social Security for income have been forced to make some tough financial choices amid record high prices.

TITLE: Building credit is one of the most important things young adults can do. Here's how to get started
SUMMARY: Your three-digit credit score represents your credit risk and impacts whether or not you can get a loan or credit card, as well as the interest rate you'll pay.

TITLE: Worried about the Fed's latest rate hike? Here's what advisors say about managing your money
SUMMARY: Consumers may be worried about higher borrowing costs and inflation following the Fed's latest rate hike. Here's what financial advisors recommend.

TITLE: Investors have access to more actively managed exchange-traded funds. Here's how they may help during market volatility
SUMMARY: Since a 2019 federal securities ruling made it easier to offer actively managed ETFs, a growing number of funds using that strategy have come to market.

TITLE: 'Panic is not a strategy.' How investors, advisors can look beyond the traditional 60/40 portfolio in the second half of 2022
SUMMARY: When it comes to market volatility and rising recession risks, the best defense is a solid investment strategy, experts at CNBC's FA Summit said.

TITLE: Nearly two-thirds of millennial millionaires believe U.S. economy will be stronger by end of 2022, CNBC survey finds
SUMMARY: Most millennial millionaires feel optimistic about the economy, according to the latest CNBC Millionaire Survey.

TITLE: It's a daunting time for retirees, who face the biggest inflation threat, financial advisors say
SUMMARY: Seniors living on fixed incomes may have a tough time adjusting to rapidly rising costs for consumer goods and services.

TITLE: Here's what the Federal Reserve's 0.75 percentage point rate hike — the highest in 28 years — means for you
SUMMARY: The Fed announced its highest rate hike in 28 years to fight inflation. Here's how that impacts your credit card, mortgage, car loan, student debt and savings.

TITLE: Companies from Tesla to Coinbase are laying off workers: Here are 3 things to do first if you lose your job
SUMMARY: Companies including Tesla and Coinbase have announced layoffs. Losing your job and income is incredibly disruptive. Focusing on these first steps can help.

TITLE: The Federal Reserve just hiked interest rates by 0.75 percentage point. How raising rates may help slow inflation
SUMMARY: Consumers may not be looking forward to higher interest rates while they're paying more for necessities. Here's how raising rates helps inflation.

TITLE: Bitcoin has lost more than 50% of its value this year. Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: Bitcoin's recent plummet looks poised to continue. Here's what experts recommend investors keep in mind.

TITLE: Here are some tips to stay on track with your retirement and short-term goals amid choppy markets
SUMMARY: A bear market is looming while the Federal Reserve is poised to raise interest rates. Here are the money moves experts say you may want to consider.

TITLE: 'Be very defensive.' What financial advisors are telling their clients as the markets tumble
SUMMARY: Amid all the scary signs in the economy, there are steps investors can take to protect their money, financial advisors say.

TITLE: Federal Reserve could boost rates by 75 basis points this week: 3 money moves to make first
SUMMARY: After May's disappointing consumer price index report, some analysts are now expecting a 75 basis point hike from the Fed on Wednesday. Here's how to prepare.

TITLE: What to know as S&P 500 enters bear market territory: ‘The bottom line is, it’s a tough time,’ says financial advisor
SUMMARY: Investors use the term "bear market" to describe a deep and sustained market downturn. It's a decline of 20% or more from recent highs.

TITLE: IRS boosts standard mileage rate deduction to 62.5 cents per mile, a 4 cent hike, as gas soars to more than $5 a gallon
SUMMARY: The IRS will boost the standard mileage rate by 4 cents, to 62.5 cents per mile, starting on July 1. The midyear change is due to soaring gas prices.

TITLE: These 10 states have been hit hardest by Social Security staffing cuts, contributing to long waits for customer service
SUMMARY: New data shows which states have been hit hardest with regard to Social Security staff losses and declines in disability services.

TITLE: Charles Schwab to pay $187 million to settle SEC charges that it misled robo-advisor clients on fees
SUMMARY: The Securities and Exchange Commission alleged the firm didn't disclose a "cash drag" to clients of Schwab Intelligent Portfolios.

TITLE: Despite the bitcoin selloff, it’s still an asset class that is accessible to anyone, says blockchain educator
SUMMARY: CNBC spoke with The Blockchain Foundation's Cleve Mesidor about cryptocurrency's future and how to keep the space from looking like the old world of finance.
